posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: We know everyone is eager to start programming their 2024 robots, but things are running a bit behind schedule.  We don‚Äôt have an exact timeline for when the 2024 Game Tools and WPILib releases will be available, but we‚Äôll get them out as soon as we can.  In the meantime, please don‚Äôt install the beta software‚Äìdoing so will just create more work for you later.  Thanks for your patience!

posts.name: s-neff
posts.cooked: Thank you for the heads up Peter. For the ‚Äúdon‚Äôt have an exact timeline‚Äù, do you think we are still talking sometime this weekend or waiting for NI to get back to the office Monday morning to ungate some steps?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: It‚Äôs actively being worked, so still hoping for sometime this weekend.
Should RI3D teams just use the beta?

posts.name: Big Sky Robotics -- Montana State University Ri3D
posts.cooked:
We are using 2023 we have had problems in the past with vendor deps getting update in the past so we always use the previous years now.

Joshua
posts.display_username: Big Sky Robotics -- Montana State University Ri3D

posts.name: Jason Daming
posts.cooked: I would if you can‚Äôt wait. Your transition to the release version will be easier than if you use 2023.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
Update:

NI Game Tools are available for download ( Installing the FRC Game Tools ‚Äî FIRST Robotics Competition documentation )

WPILib is on track to post in the next couple hours

link_counts.title: Installing the FRC Game Tools ‚Äî FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: jdao
posts.cooked: Note: You need to set the ReadTheDocs version to ‚Äòlatest‚Äô in the bottom-left corner for the link to go to the NI Game Tools iso file.

posts.name: Dan Katzuv
posts.cooked: The link on the stable version is https://packages.wpilib.workers.dev/game-tools/ni-frc-2024-game-tools_24.0.0_offline.iso which seems like the correct one.

posts.name: jdao
posts.cooked: It was just going to the NI website for me for a bit, maybe my browser was just caching it?

posts.name: Jason Daming
posts.cooked: Latest is now equivalent of stable.

posts.name: Brian Z
posts.cooked: The current version of the game tools is missing the smart dashboard and shuffleboard. Anyone else having this problem?

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:

SmartDashboard and Shuffleboard launch the respective dashboards included with the C++ and Java WPILib installation.

suggested_topics.fancy_title: Issues with PathPlanner on the fly generation
suggested_topics.title: Issues with PathPlanner on the fly generation
suggested_topics.excerpt: We fixed it! It turns out that one of our drive motors was inverted (CCW+ when it should have been CW+). Thank you all for your help with this!
